page.title: 09STREETS AND BUILDINGS vii.
page.content: High St.ii. Behind the Fox & Hounds Public House was the village blacksmith.John Head was the last farrier in the village. The Fire Station, The Stags Head P.H. and the Old Manor House complete the picture of Old High St. except for two recent additions: a small bookmakers premises,and a Chinese Take-away Meal shop are in two converted cottages. Beyond the Old Manor House, apart from a plastics factory, the street is residential.The New Manor House (circa 1780) has been replaced by sheltered accommodation for the elderly whilst the grounds have been built up as a Council House Estate.
